content:
Has anyone seen the following?

Dask needs bokeh >= 0.13.0 for the dashboard.

Install with conda: conda install bokeh>=0.13.0

Install with pip: pip install bokeh>=0.13.0

I have bokeh version 2.3.3.
Thanks.

which version of dask/distributed are you running?

conda list | grep -E 'dask|distributed|bokeh'

Thanks, @Anderson Banihirwe
These are the versions:

bokeh                     2.3.3            py37h89c1867_0    conda-forge
dask                      2.12.0                   pypi_0    pypi
dask-core                 2021.7.2           pyhd8ed1ab_0    conda-forge
dask-jobqueue             0.7.2                    pypi_0    pypi
dask-labextension         1.0.3                    pypi_0    pypi
distributed               2021.6.0                 pypi_0    pypi

dask                      2.12.0                   pypi_0    pypi
dask-core                 2021.7.2           pyhd8ed1ab_0    conda-forge

the version mismatch for dask and dask-core are likely the culprits... To resolve this issue and avoid future version mismatches, I recommend enabling the conda/pip interoperability feature: 

conda config --set pip_interop_enabled True

and then updating your environment:

conda update --all -c conda-forge

@Anderson Banihirwe, thanks for your suggestion. I still have the issue:

Dask needs bokeh >= 1.0 for the dashboard.

Install with conda: conda install bokeh>=1.0

Install with pip: pip install bokeh>=1

Here is my conda environment:
